meanings.definition: Tamanduas: a type of anteater found in South and Central America.
meanings.sent1: In the zoo, we saw two tamanduas climbing trees.
meanings.sent2: The tamanduas are known for their long tongues used to catch ants.
meanings.sent3: The tamanduas had a picnic with the other animals, using their long tongues to grab snacks.
meanings.sent4: The tamanduas in the forest are like living vacuum cleaners, sucking up ants.
meanings.sent5: I will never forget the sight of the tamanduas slurping up ants with their tongues.

meanings.definition: Tamanduas: plural form of tamandua, referring to more than one of these animals.
meanings.sent1: The tamanduas in the exhibit looked playful and curious.
meanings.sent2: We learned about the tamanduas and their unique feeding habits.
meanings.sent3: The tamanduas threw a surprise party for the zookeeper, bringing lots of gifts.
meanings.sent4: The tamanduas in the forest moved together like a synchronized dance.
meanings.sent5: The tamanduas stood out in the crowd with their distinctive markings.
